For another version see [Colossus (Wings of Liberty and Heart of the Swarm)](/starcraft2/Colossus_(Wings_of_Liberty_and_Heart_of_the_Swarm) "Colossus (Wings of Liberty and Heart of the Swarm)") ._ This article is a [unit](/starcraft2/Units "Units") [stub](/starcraft2/Liquipedia:Stub "Liquipedia:Stub") . You can help Liquipedia by [expanding it](https://liquipedia.net/starcraft2/index.php?title=Colossus_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit) . \[[e](https://liquipedia.net/starcraft2/index.php?title=Colossus_%28Legacy_of_the_Void%29&action=edit§ion=0)\ \]\[[h](/starcraft2/Template:Infobox_unit "Template:Infobox unit")\ \]![Protoss](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/0/0f/Protoss_race_icon.png/30px-Protoss_race_icon.png%20%22Protoss%22)¬†Colossus [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/6/6c/SC2Colossus.jpg/600px-SC2Colossus.jpg)](/starcraft2/File:SC2Colossus.jpg) [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/6/6c/SC2Colossus.jpg/600px-SC2Colossus.jpg)](/starcraft2/File:SC2Colossus.jpg) Unit Information Type: Ground Unit Description: Battle strider with a powerful area attack. Can step up or down cliffs. Can be targeted by anti-air weapons. Built From: [Robotics Facility](/starcraft2/Robotics_Facility "Robotics Facility") Requirements: * [Robotics Bay](/starcraft2/Robotics_Bay "Robotics Bay") Cost: [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/a/a4/Minerals.gif)](/starcraft2/Minerals "Minerals") ¬†300¬†[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/2/2e/Vespene-protoss.gif)](/starcraft2/Gas "Gas") ¬†200¬†[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/a/a4/Buildtime_protoss.gif)](/starcraft2/Game_Speed "Game Speed") ¬†54¬†[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/8/86/Supply-protoss.gif)](/starcraft2/Supply "Supply") ¬†6 [Hotkey](/starcraft2/Hotkeys_per_Race "Hotkeys per Race") : C Attack 1: Thermal Lance Targets: Ground Damage: 10 (+1) (x2) [DPS](/starcraft2/Damage_Per_Second "Damage Per Second") : 18.7 (+1.87) [Cooldown](/starcraft2/Cooldown "Cooldown") : 1.07 Bonus: +5 (+1) vs [Light](/starcraft2/Light "Light") Bonus DPS: +9.3 (+1.87) vs [Light](/starcraft2/Light "Light") [Range](/starcraft2/Range "Range") : 7 (+2) Unit stats Defense: ![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/e/e2/Icon_Hitpoints.png) 200 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/8/82/Icon_Shields.png)](/starcraft2/Plasma_Shield "Plasma Shield") 150 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/5/5e/Icon_Armor.png)](/starcraft2/Armor "Armor") 1 (+1) Attributes: [Armored](/starcraft2/Armored "Armored") , [Massive](/starcraft2/Massive "Massive") , [Mechanical](/starcraft2/Mechanical "Mechanical") Sight: 10 Speed: 3.15 Cargo size: 8 Strong against: * [Marine](/starcraft2/Marine "Marine") * [Zealot](/starcraft2/Zealot "Zealot") * [Zergling](/starcraft2/Zergling "Zergling") Weak against: * [Corruptor](/starcraft2/Corruptor "Corruptor") * [Viking](/starcraft2/Viking "Viking") * [Tempest](/starcraft2/Tempest "Tempest") Contents -------- * [1 Description](#Description) * [2 Ability](#Ability) * [3 Upgrade](#Upgrade) * [4 Competitive Usage](#Competitive_Usage) * [4.1 General](#General) * [4.2 Vs. Protoss](#Vs._Protoss) * [4.3 Vs. Terran](#Vs._Terran) * [4.4 Vs. Zerg](#Vs._Zerg) * [5 Gallery](#Gallery) * [6 Quotes](#Quotes) * [7 Patch Changes](#Patch_Changes) * [8 References](#References) Description\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Colossus_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=1 "Edit section: Description")\ \] ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The **Colossus** (_plural_ -lossi, -lossuses) is a massive [Protoss](/starcraft2/Protoss "Protoss") battle strider that towers over all other ground units on the battlefield. It is built at the [Robotics Facility](/starcraft2/Robotics_Facility "Robotics Facility") , but requires the presence of a [Robotics Bay](/starcraft2/Robotics_Bay "Robotics Bay") to be unlocked. Its long-range dual Thermal Lances target units in a wide linear [area of effect](/starcraft2/Splash_damage "Splash damage") , perpendicular to the Colossus's direction of fire. This makes the Colossus a powerful siege unit that can quickly destroy an enemy's ground forces. Colossi have massive legs and enormous height, which can both be an advantage and disadvantage. Firstly, the height allows anti-air attacks to hit it; care must be taken with Colossi to make sure units like [Vikings](/starcraft2/Viking "Viking") or [Corruptors](/starcraft2/Corruptor "Corruptor") do not pick them off in battle as they are relatively fragile units for their cost. Secondly, its weapon comes with a base range of 7, and the [Extended Thermal Lance](/starcraft2/Extended_Thermal_Lance "Extended Thermal Lance") upgrade extends it to an impressive attack range of 9, which allows it to attack from behind the main Protoss army. Thirdly, the legs grant them the ability to traverse cliffs and provide vision of high ground areas, as well as stacking over other units in the player's army. However unlike smaller ranged units, if a Colossus is on the high ground and attacks enemy units on the low ground, the enemy gains temporary vision of the Colossus and can return fire. This revealing mechanic does put a limit on their ability to exploit high ground, but can still be useful for engaging short ranged units. Overall, care must be taken to account for these unique characteristics, but these also help make the colossus a powerful unit. Ability\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Colossus_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=2 "Edit section: Ability")\ \] --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [Cliff Walk](/starcraft2/Cliff_Walk "Cliff Walk") | | | | --- | --- | | [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/6/67/Cliff_walk.png/61px-Cliff_walk.png)](/starcraft2/File:Cliff_walk.png) | Allows the [Colossus](/starcraft2/Colossus "Colossus")
to walk up and down cliffs. | Upgrade\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Colossus_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=3 "Edit section: Upgrade")\ \] --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [Extended Thermal Lance](/starcraft2/Extended_Thermal_Lance "Extended Thermal Lance") | | | | --- | --- | | [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/8/81/Extended_thermal_lances.gif)](/starcraft2/File:Extended_thermal_lances.gif) | **[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/a/a4/Minerals.gif)](/starcraft2/Minerals "Minerals")

Increases the range of the Colossus weapon by 2. | Competitive Usage\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Colossus_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=4 "Edit section: Competitive Usage")\ \] ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ### General\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Colossus_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=5 "Edit section: General")\ \] The Colossus is a heavy support unit that deals large amounts of damage over a moderately sized area (2.8 width, 0.3 depth). The massive battle strider is capable of obliterating large amounts of light ground forces within seconds. The Legacy of the Void version of the Colossus does less damage in general than earlier versions of the unit. In return for +1 base range (though the same total with Extended Thermal Lance) and greater attack speed, its base damage was reduced. It does bonus damage against light units, and thus can be effective against massed light units such as Marines, Zerglings, and Zealots. Because of their damage reduction and other new units in the meta, the [Immortal](/starcraft2/Immortal "Immortal") has succeeded the [Colossi](/starcraft2/Colossus "Colossus") as the premier Anchor unit of the Robotics Facility. Versus Zerg, the [Ravager](/starcraft2/Ravager "Ravager") 's Corrosive Bile destroys forcefields, removing the most important tool when supporting Colossus armies, and [Lurkers](/starcraft2/Lurker "Lurker") can stall these walkers long enough to tech to the many counters against them. Alongside that, Lurkers rip the standard complementary gateway unit to Colossi, the [Stalker](/starcraft2/Stalker "Stalker") , which would otherwise normally provide anti-armor and anti-air. In PvP [Disruptors](/starcraft2/Disruptor "Disruptor") have become the primary form of splash damage because they have the ability to blow up Protoss units in less hits, are cheaper than [Archons](/starcraft2/Archon "Archon") , and don't need any upgrades to achieve damage. Therefore it is only against Terran now where Colossi are most suitable, providing consistent splash that [Marine](/starcraft2/Marine "Marine") micro cannot mitigate. Researching Extended Thermal Lance remains standard in all match-ups if Colossi are to be built, as the upgrade grants it longer range than most other ground units, allowing it to fire from a safe distance. It is only outranged by the Terran [Siege Tank](/starcraft2/Siege_Tank "Siege Tank") in its immobile Siege Mode and the Zerg [Lurker](/starcraft2/Lurker "Lurker") with [Seismic Spines](/starcraft2/Seismic_Spines "Seismic Spines") . Along with Cliff Walk, this allows the Colossus to kite ground units using the terrain to its advantage. Most ground units will not be able to pursue correctly managed Colossi without taking high amounts of damage or simply dying. The Colossus's main weakness is its additional vulnerability to air attacks. [Vikings](/starcraft2/Viking "Viking") , [Corruptors](/starcraft2/Corruptor "Corruptor") , and [Tempests](/starcraft2/Tempest "Tempest") deal bonus damage to Massive or Armored units, both of which apply to the Colossus. As Air units can easily flank the Protoss army, they may circumvent the Protoss anti-air and destroy the powerful Colossi without risk. A Colossus-heavy army needs to be bolstered with appropriate numbers of anti-air support, in order to combat aerial threats. There are a few units with different anti-air and anti-ground weapons. Of these, the [Tempest](/starcraft2/Tempest "Tempest") , [Queen](/starcraft2/Queen "Queen") , and [Infested Terran](/starcraft2/Infested_Terran "Infested Terran") will prefer to attack the Colossus with their AA weapon, and the [Battlecruiser](/starcraft2/Battlecruiser "Battlecruiser") attacks with its AG weapon. If the [Thor](/starcraft2/Thor "Thor") engages with its AA weapon (which is longer-range), it will continue attacking with it, but if it begins to engage at low enough range, it prefers its AG weapon. The Colossus synergizes well with [Sentries](/starcraft2/Sentry "Sentry") and [Stalkers](/starcraft2/Stalker "Stalker") . Force fields can be used both to block off and to entrap enemy ground units (allowing for maximized splash damage) while Stalkers provide anti-air support and act as a meat shield (alongside [Zealots](/starcraft2/Zealot "Zealot") ); the Blink ability may also increase the Stalkers' damage absorption. With its height, the Colossus is able to reveal areas atop cliffs, enabling allied units to fire upwards on to high ground, as well as enabling Stalkers to [Blink](/starcraft2/Blink "Blink") to targeted locations, which would otherwise be inaccesible. One Colossus fills a [Warp Prism](/starcraft2/Warp_Prism "Warp Prism") . As a rule of thumb, it is possible to sustain continuous Colossi production out of double Robotics Facilities per mining base, so long as no [Chrono Boost](/starcraft2/Chrono_Boost "Chrono Boost") is used. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/e/e4/ProtossIcon.png/30px-ProtossIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:ProtossIcon.png) Protoss\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Colossus_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=6 "Edit section: Vs. Protoss")\ \] Colossi are not typically used in PvP matches in Legacy of the Void. Protoss players typically use Immortal, Archon, Chargelot (IAC) or Blink/Disruptor compositions instead of Colossus-based armies. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/9/94/TerranIcon.png/30px-TerranIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:TerranIcon.png) Terran\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Colossus_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=7 "Edit section: Vs. Terran")\ \] Being the most consistent source of splash damage in PvT, Colossi are not susceptible to micro techniques Terran players can use against the other main splash damage options, [Psi Storm](/starcraft2/Psi_Storm "Psi Storm") and [Disruptors](/starcraft2/Disruptor "Disruptor") . Colossi are good against [Marine](/starcraft2/Marine "Marine") \-heavy compositions owing to their bonus against Light units. They are however very weak against large masses of [Marauders](/starcraft2/Marauder "Marauder") , both because Colossi have no bonus damage against them and because Marauders deal bonus damage against the Armored Colossi. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/d/d1/ZergIcon.png/30px-ZergIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:ZergIcon.png) Zerg\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Colossus_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=8 "Edit section: Vs. Zerg")\ \] Colossi can be effective if the Zerg decides to make [Hydralisk](/starcraft2/Hydralisk "Hydralisk") , [Zergling](/starcraft2/Zergling "Zergling") or [Baneling](/starcraft2/Baneling "Baneling") \-heavy armies. Against Armored units such as [Roaches](/starcraft2/Roach "Roach") , they are not as cost-effective as their heavy-fire counterpart, the [Immortal](/starcraft2/Immortal "Immortal") . Use of Colossus-based armies in PvZ is very limited as they require a significant investment to bring onto the field. While they can be effective at a certain point, they only remain so while the Zerg makes nothing but Lings, Banes or Hydras or a combination thereof. They also fare quite badly facing Zerg Hive tech. [Vipers](/starcraft2/Viper "Viper") are useful, [Abducting](/starcraft2/Abduct "Abduct") Colossi right into the Zerg forces, killing them before they can deal any real damage. [Ultralisks](/starcraft2/Ultralisk "Ultralisk") with their high armor (and their large size making them less vlnerable to splash damage) take low amounts of damage from Colossi, hence necessitating the use of Immortals. [Corruptors](/starcraft2/Corruptor "Corruptor") work as well as Vikings, with the Colossus's trait of anti-air vulnerability. [Brood Lords](/starcraft2/Brood_Lord "Brood Lord") are also deadly as they outrange Colossi and deal large amounts of ground damage. [Lurkers](/starcraft2/Lurker "Lurker") , especially with Adaptive Talons, are also an option against Colossi, as they slow the advance of a Colossus-based army if it lacks Detection. Zerg](#Vs._Zerg) * [5 Gallery](#Gallery) * [6 Quotes](#Quotes) * [7 Patch Changes](#Patch_Changes) * [8 References](#References) Description\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Colossus_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=1 "Edit section: Description")\ \] ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The **Colossus** (_plural_ -lossi, -lossuses) is a massive [Protoss](/starcraft2/Protoss "Protoss") battle strider that towers over all other ground units on the battlefield. It is built at the [Robotics Facility](/starcraft2/Robotics_Facility "Robotics Facility") , but requires the presence of a [Robotics Bay](/starcraft2/Robotics_Bay "Robotics Bay") to be unlocked. Its long-range dual Thermal Lances target units in a wide linear [area of effect](/starcraft2/Splash_damage "Splash damage") , perpendicular to the Colossus's direction of fire. This makes the Colossus a powerful siege unit that can quickly destroy an enemy's ground forces. Colossi have massive legs and enormous height, which can both be an advantage and disadvantage. Firstly, the height allows anti-air attacks to hit it; care must be taken with Colossi to make sure units like [Vikings](/starcraft2/Viking "Viking") or [Corruptors](/starcraft2/Corruptor "Corruptor") do not pick them off in battle as they are relatively fragile units for their cost. Secondly, its weapon comes with a base range of 7, and the [Extended Thermal Lance](/starcraft2/Extended_Thermal_Lance "Extended Thermal Lance") upgrade extends it to an impressive attack range of 9, which allows it to attack from behind the main Protoss army. Thirdly, the legs grant them the ability to traverse cliffs and provide vision of high ground areas, as well as stacking over other units in the player's army. However unlike smaller ranged units, if a Colossus is on the high ground and attacks enemy units on the low ground, the enemy gains temporary vision of the Colossus and can return fire. This revealing mechanic does put a limit on their ability to exploit high ground, but can still be useful for engaging short ranged units. Overall, care must be taken to account for these unique characteristics, but these also help make the colossus a powerful unit. Increases the range of the Colossus weapon by 2. | Competitive Usage\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Colossus_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=4 "Edit section: Competitive Usage")\ \] ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ### General\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Colossus_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=5 "Edit section: General")\ \] The Colossus is a heavy support unit that deals large amounts of damage over a moderately sized area (2.8 width, 0.3 depth). The massive battle strider is capable of obliterating large amounts of light ground forces within seconds. The Legacy of the Void version of the Colossus does less damage in general than earlier versions of the unit. In return for +1 base range (though the same total with Extended Thermal Lance) and greater attack speed, its base damage was reduced. It does bonus damage against light units, and thus can be effective against massed light units such as Marines, Zerglings, and Zealots. Because of their damage reduction and other new units in the meta, the [Immortal](/starcraft2/Immortal "Immortal") has succeeded the [Colossi](/starcraft2/Colossus "Colossus") as the premier Anchor unit of the Robotics Facility. Versus Zerg, the [Ravager](/starcraft2/Ravager "Ravager") 's Corrosive Bile destroys forcefields, removing the most important tool when supporting Colossus armies, and [Lurkers](/starcraft2/Lurker "Lurker") can stall these walkers long enough to tech to the many counters against them. Alongside that, Lurkers rip the standard complementary gateway unit to Colossi, the [Stalker](/starcraft2/Stalker "Stalker") , which would otherwise normally provide anti-armor and anti-air. In PvP [Disruptors](/starcraft2/Disruptor "Disruptor") have become the primary form of splash damage because they have the ability to blow up Protoss units in less hits, are cheaper than [Archons](/starcraft2/Archon "Archon") , and don't need any upgrades to achieve damage. Therefore it is only against Terran now where Colossi are most suitable, providing consistent splash that [Marine](/starcraft2/Marine "Marine") micro cannot mitigate. Researching Extended Thermal Lance remains standard in all match-ups if Colossi are to be built, as the upgrade grants it longer range than most other ground units, allowing it to fire from a safe distance. It is only outranged by the Terran [Siege Tank](/starcraft2/Siege_Tank "Siege Tank") in its immobile Siege Mode and the Zerg [Lurker](/starcraft2/Lurker "Lurker") with [Seismic Spines](/starcraft2/Seismic_Spines "Seismic Spines") . Along with Cliff Walk, this allows the Colossus to kite ground units using the terrain to its advantage. Most ground units will not be able to pursue correctly managed Colossi without taking high amounts of damage or simply dying. The Colossus's main weakness is its additional vulnerability to air attacks. [Vikings](/starcraft2/Viking "Viking") , [Corruptors](/starcraft2/Corruptor "Corruptor") , and [Tempests](/starcraft2/Tempest "Tempest") deal bonus damage to Massive or Armored units, both of which apply to the Colossus. As Air units can easily flank the Protoss army, they may circumvent the Protoss anti-air and destroy the powerful Colossi without risk. A Colossus-heavy army needs to be bolstered with appropriate numbers of anti-air support, in order to combat aerial threats. There are a few units with different anti-air and anti-ground weapons. Of these, the [Tempest](/starcraft2/Tempest "Tempest") , [Queen](/starcraft2/Queen "Queen") , and [Infested Terran](/starcraft2/Infested_Terran "Infested Terran") will prefer to attack the Colossus with their AA weapon, and the [Battlecruiser](/starcraft2/Battlecruiser "Battlecruiser") attacks with its AG weapon. If the [Thor](/starcraft2/Thor "Thor") engages with its AA weapon (which is longer-range), it will continue attacking with it, but if it begins to engage at low enough range, it prefers its AG weapon. The Colossus synergizes well with [Sentries](/starcraft2/Sentry "Sentry") and [Stalkers](/starcraft2/Stalker "Stalker") . Force fields can be used both to block off and to entrap enemy ground units (allowing for maximized splash damage) while Stalkers provide anti-air support and act as a meat shield (alongside [Zealots](/starcraft2/Zealot "Zealot") ); the Blink ability may also increase the Stalkers' damage absorption. With its height, the Colossus is able to reveal areas atop cliffs, enabling allied units to fire upwards on to high ground, as well as enabling Stalkers to [Blink](/starcraft2/Blink "Blink") to targeted locations, which would otherwise be inaccesible. One Colossus fills a [Warp Prism](/starcraft2/Warp_Prism "Warp Prism") . As a rule of thumb, it is possible to sustain continuous Colossi production out of double Robotics Facilities per mining base, so long as no [Chrono Boost](/starcraft2/Chrono_Boost "Chrono Boost") is used. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/e/e4/ProtossIcon.png/30px-ProtossIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:ProtossIcon.png) Protoss\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Colossus_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=6 "Edit section: Vs. Protoss")\ \] Colossi are not typically used in PvP matches in Legacy of the Void. Protoss players typically use Immortal, Archon, Chargelot (IAC) or Blink/Disruptor compositions instead of Colossus-based armies. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/9/94/TerranIcon.png/30px-TerranIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:TerranIcon.png) Terran\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Colossus_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=7 "Edit section: Vs. Terran")\ \] Being the most consistent source of splash damage in PvT, Colossi are not susceptible to micro techniques Terran players can use against the other main splash damage options, [Psi Storm](/starcraft2/Psi_Storm "Psi Storm") and [Disruptors](/starcraft2/Disruptor "Disruptor") . Colossi are good against [Marine](/starcraft2/Marine "Marine") \-heavy compositions owing to their bonus against Light units. They are however very weak against large masses of [Marauders](/starcraft2/Marauder "Marauder") , both because Colossi have no bonus damage against them and because Marauders deal bonus damage against the Armored Colossi. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/d/d1/ZergIcon.png/30px-ZergIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:ZergIcon.png) Zerg\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Colossus_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=8 "Edit section: Vs. Zerg")\ \] Colossi can be effective if the Zerg decides to make [Hydralisk](/starcraft2/Hydralisk "Hydralisk") , [Zergling](/starcraft2/Zergling "Zergling") or [Baneling](/starcraft2/Baneling "Baneling") \-heavy armies. Against Armored units such as [Roaches](/starcraft2/Roach "Roach") , they are not as cost-effective as their heavy-fire counterpart, the [Immortal](/starcraft2/Immortal "Immortal") . Use of Colossus-based armies in PvZ is very limited as they require a significant investment to bring onto the field. While they can be effective at a certain point, they only remain so while the Zerg makes nothing but Lings, Banes or Hydras or a combination thereof. They also fare quite badly facing Zerg Hive tech. [Vipers](/starcraft2/Viper "Viper") are useful, [Abducting](/starcraft2/Abduct "Abduct") Colossi right into the Zerg forces, killing them before they can deal any real damage. [Ultralisks](/starcraft2/Ultralisk "Ultralisk") with their high armor (and their large size making them less vlnerable to splash damage) take low amounts of damage from Colossi, hence necessitating the use of Immortals. [Corruptors](/starcraft2/Corruptor "Corruptor") work as well as Vikings, with the Colossus's trait of anti-air vulnerability. [Brood Lords](/starcraft2/Brood_Lord "Brood Lord") are also deadly as they outrange Colossi and deal large amounts of ground damage. [Lurkers](/starcraft2/Lurker "Lurker") , especially with Adaptive Talons, are also an option against Colossi, as they slow the advance of a Colossus-based army if it lacks Detection.
